Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    A class for a Board, which has an ArrayList of pieces that stores all the pieces currently on the board. Has methods to manipulate and return parts of the board.
    Version:
    May 26, 2020
    Author:
    Shreyas Kaasyap, Period: 1, Assignment: ChessBot, Sources: Shreyas Kaasyap, Sidharth Kannan, Leo Yang

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board()
      Makes a board with the position set as the starting position of a chess game Instantiates fields
      Board(java.util.ArrayList<Piece> board) 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      char[][] charBoard()
      returns a matrix of the current Board, capital letter for a white piece, lowercase for black
      java.lang.Boolean check(Location loc)
      Return true if there is no piece at a given location, false otherwise
      java.util.ArrayList<Piece> copyBoard()
      Returns the set of pieces on a board
      boolean equals(Board other)
      Checks if two boards have the same pieces in the same spots
      Board getBestBoard(boolean color)
      Returns the best next possible board based on the material evalution of the board for a given color
      java.util.ArrayList<Piece> getBoard()
      returns the set of the pieces currently on the board
      Piece getPiece(Location loc)
      Return the pieces at a given location, returns null if there is no piece at that location
      java.util.ArrayList<Board> getPossibleMoves(boolean color)
      returns the set of all possible moves for a side(color is true = white, false = black), removes illegal moves, returns null if the current position is checkmate
      int getValue()
      Returns the value of the position, adds up all the material value of every piece on the baord
      void printBoard()
      prints out the currentBoard, uppercase for white, lowercase for black, prints out the rows and columns as well
      Board updateBoard(Piece p1, Piece p2)
      updates the board, removes the piece p1, and adds the piece p2, takes care of the possibility of p2 is taking another piece, p1 and p2 will be the same type

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

        public Board(java.util.ArrayList<Piece> board)
        Parameters:

        Checks if two boards have the same pieces in the same spots

        Returns:

        Returns:

      • getPossibleMoves

        public java.util.ArrayList<Board> getPossibleMoves(boolean color)
        returns the set of all possible moves for a side(color is true = white, false = black), removes illegal moves, returns null if the current position is checkmate
        Parameters:
        color - true if it is white's turn, false otherwise
        Returns:
        ArrayList the set of all possible resulting Boards

      • getBestBoard

        public Board getBestBoard(boolean color)
        Returns the best next possible board based on the material evalution of the board for a given color
        Parameters:
        color - true if it white to move, false otherwise
        Returns:
        Board

      • updateBoard

        public Board updateBoard(Piece p1,
                         Piece p2)
        updates the board, removes the piece p1, and adds the piece p2, takes care of the possibility of p2 is taking another piece, p1 and p2 will be the same type
        Parameters:
        p1 - the piece to remove
        p2 - the piece to put on the board
        Returns:
        Board, the updated Board

      • charBoard

        public char[][] charBoard()
        returns a matrix of the current Board, capital letter for a white piece, lowercase for black
        Returns:
        char[][]

      • printBoard

        public void printBoard()
        prints out the currentBoard, uppercase for white, lowercase for black, prints out the rows and columns as well
